answers.answer: I'm sorry, I got the LDL and HDL backwards. :-P  the good kind is low. the bad kind is normal. :-P

question: Hello,Thank you in advance for any imput you may have.I currently am being treated for a prolactin producing pituitary tumor, high blood pressure, hashimotos thyroid, type 2 diabetes and vitamin D deficiancy.  I am 30 years old and up until the tumor I was underweight.  I am now overweight at 5'1" 160 lbs.  My blood pressure is around 150/95 and with a very mild medication it has come down somewhat.  I have high triglycerides that are around 230 and Low LDL and normal HDL.I have recently been experiencing palpatations which startle me when they occur.  I get slighly light headed and dizzy when they occur intensly and it takes a moment for me to regain my composure.  They don't hurt, they just make me feel very uneasy.  I have been having slight shortness of breath, swelling in hands and feet and inability to lose weight.  Othertimes I feel them along with some pressure and mild pain, which I think might be muscular from me tensing up.I am on a medication (Cabergoline - Dostinex) for my pituitary tumor that is known to cause heart valve problems and other types of heart disease.  My dr. has ordered an echocardiogram because of this, especially after I mentioned the palpatations.   She said most cases have been attributed to those at higher dosages used to treat Parkinson's... but better safe than sorry. I have been on the medication for 9 months.Does this sound consistant to a heart valve problem to you?
title: Palpatations from medication?
